dublin_core.dcvalue: This paper describes two cases of using telementoring from the Prince of Wales Hospital POWH Ophthalmology Department Sydney to Bourke Base hospital a rural hospital in far west New South Wales Australia Eye trauma occurs frequently in a rural setting and it can be difficult to assess the extent of the injury without a specialist ophthalmic service One of the aims of the teleophthalmology is to facilitate the transfer of ophthalmic skills to local health providers such as general practitioners We demonstrate that the removal of corneal foreign bodies and rust rings can be effectively supervised via teleophthalmology
Telemedicine journal and e-health : the official journal of the American Telemedicine Association
Teleophthalmology-assisted corneal foreign body removal in a rural hospital.
